title: Augusta County: D. V. Gilkeson to Gilkeson's brother (probably Hugh Gilkeson), August 31, 1867
summary: Gilkeson discusses the year's crops and resignedly mentions that labor is "all to hire." He delivers news about the family and suggests that his brother try the nursery business, to avoid the bad luck often attached to farming.
keywords: African Americans, Agriculture, Family, Home Front, Women, American Civil War
